title: [Large-Scale] Assessment Utilization Strategies for Instructional Design: A Qualitative Research-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of fundamental instructional design concepts and experience with project-based assessment
context.additional_context: Professionals in healthcare, legal, or technical fields capable of self-directed learning using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more improvement strategies using assessment tools in real educational design cases.
Learners can apply qualitative research methods (interviews/observations) to project-based assessments and propose design improvements.
Learners can design an educational improvement process using informal assessment techniques (peer review/self-checks) in a limited-budget environment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
